section.title: Download
Installation
section.para: Just unzip to downloaded file to a new folder. You don't have to install &product;.

section.title: Launch
section.para: To launch &product; double-click the file rmoffice-&version;.jar. It is an executable java archive. If you don't have Java installed on you computer, download it from http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html

If you have Java installed, but not configured properly you can type in your shell
start javaw -jar rmoffice-&version;.jar
or if javaw.exe is not in your Path modify the path in start-rmoffice.bat (for Windows)

section.title: Where is my user.preferences file?
section.para: By default there is no &usrprops; file in your home directory (directory .rmoffice). You have to copy the &usrprops; file from distribution to you <home directory>/.rmoffice/&usrprops;.

If you aren't sure where your home directory is, check the About dialog: Start &product; and go to the main menu "Help > About &product;". In the About dialog you can find the path to the &usrprops; file.

section.title: Sourcebook exclusion
section.para: You can exclude professions, races, training packages, skills, spell lists from displaying, e.g. if you don't own all source books and you just want to see the professions and races from some source books.

Default is no exclusion, but if you want to exclude some source books you have to put the entry "excludes=" to the &usrprops; file. Put one or more of the following values as comma separated list:
RMFRP including the three spell laws
CHARL Character Law (profs and races)
SOHK School of Hard Knock
ARCC Arcane Companion
ALCC alchemie Companion
ELEMC Fire & Ice
MENTC Mentalismn Companion
CHANC Channling Companion
ESSC Essence Comnpanion
MAC Martial Arts Companion
RMC Rolemaster Companions
R&C Races and Cultures (for races)
CONSC Construction Companion
C&R Castle & Ruins
You can exclude following scopes for races and languages:
MIDDLEEARTH Races with MiddleEarth-Scope
BASE Races with BASE-Scope
SHADOWWORLD Races with Shadowworld-Scope (not available now)
Example for german publications: "excludes=RMC,ARCC,ALCC,ELEMC,MENTC,ESSC,MAC,R&C,CONSC,C&R,MIDDLEEARTH,SHADOWWORLD"

section.title: DP costs of spell list ranks increases every 5 ranks
section.para: In the level up mode the costs of the spell lists DP costs will be increased every 5 ranks by default. For spell list rank 1-5 you have to pay 1 time cost, for 6-10 it will be 2 time costs, and so on.

You can adjust or turn this feature off in the &usrprops; file. There is an property entry "spelllist-dp-increasing=5" which is the default value. If you want to turn this of, use "spelllist-dp-increasing=0". If you like to modify the interval just enter another number.

section.title: Outline image on combat status (PDF page 6)
section.para: Since version 4.2.2 by default the outline images for most races are printed on the combat status page in the PDF. If you don't like this, you can hide this outline image by configuration in the preferences file. Add the entry "outline-image=0" to you &usrprops; file.

listitem.para: Create a new character File > New character.
Select race, culture, profession
Choose armor and level
Optional: Put your minimal stats into the temp stats fields
Optional: Put your maximal stats into the pot stats fields
Optional: Mark favorite skills (you may add any new skill)
Generator > Generate character (NPC)

section.title: Magical items
section.para: Magical items have a name and features (powers, aibilities, ..). These features can be a resistance bonus, stat bonus, skill bonus or a description like "against orcs +20". All magical items are generated on the PDF on page 4.

Marking the magical item as favorite has following effects:
Stat bonus will be calculated as special bonus for the stat
Resistance bonus is not calculated into the total resistance bonus. But the item will be shown under your resistance on PDF page 1
Skill bonus won't be calculated into the total skill/weapon bonus. But the item will be shown under you skill or weapon on PDF page 1
Each magical item has a number which is printed on page 1 of the PDF and page 4, too.

listitem.para: Q: What is the goal of &product;?
A: The goal of &product; is the creation of a nice character sheet.
Q: What isn't &product;?
A: &product; will not provide during game features.
Q: How do you change a spell list from being an open list to an additional base list? Thus changing the cost.
A: Select any base spell list and click "Add modified". Edit the name and add the custom spell list
Only Linux & Adobe Acrobat: The images in the PDF are much too dark, use the default document viewer shipped with linux. Windows has no problems.

section.title: How can I add my own races?

listitem.para: Download latest race.ods from Git
Open race.ods with OpenOffice or LibreOffice and add your races. In column A you have to use a unique race ID (Example: start at 100). In column B use a resource key like "customized.race.myname"

Option a) Now add a culture to the tab "CultureData". If the race has 1 culture use same ID in column A (culture ID) and B (race ID) (Example: both 100). Put the youth ranks in the table (Number for youth ranks, r for restricted, e for everyman; 2-e for 2 youth ranks and everyman)
Option b) You want to use an existing culture? Add the race ID to column B separated with "-" (Example: 35-100 will assign the dwarf culture to your race with the ID 100)
Now we prepare RMO to load your race and culture data. Create a new directory "conf" and a sub-directory "i18n".

Open the jar file with WinRar/7Zip or similar (or rename it to zip) and extract the files race.conf and culture.conf from conf directory. Copy it to a new directory "conf". Copy from "i18n" all files to the "i18n" outside the jar.

Open race.conf in a text editor (not windows editor, use Notpad++ or similar). Select/copy your new race rows from Open/LibreOffice column A to AV and paste it at the end of the race.conf and replace all tabs by ","

Open culture.conf in the text editor. Select and copy your new culture (if you have new ones) rows from Open/LibreOffice tab "culture.conf" column A to GS and paste it to culture.conf. The format is well-formed; you just have to remove the tabs.
Add the resource key with the localization (Example: customized.race.myname=My Race Name) at the end of the locale files
Windows: Now modify your start-rmoffice.bat to: java -cp .;./rmoffice-&version;.jar net.sf.rmoffice.RMOffice
Linux/Mac: Now modify your start-rmoffice.sh to: java -cp .:./rmoffice-&version;.jar net.sf.rmoffice.RMOffice
Start &product; by using your new start script.
